techmeme.title: Meta says Facebook creators who violate Community Standards for the first time will be given the option to take a training course to remove their warning (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
Ofcom publishes an open letter to social media platforms raising concerns about the use of their tools to incite violence, following days of rioting in the UK (Natasha Lomas/TechCrunch)
Sources: Meta is in talks to license its Horizon software to Jio, which would use it to power a VR device (The Information)
Sources: Humane's Ai Pin and accessories have brought in $9M+ in sales, and $1M+ worth of product has been returned; ~7,000 Ai Pins are still in customer hands (Kylie Robison/The Verge)
Instagram is making views the primary metric across all of its formats, letting creators track the same metric across Reels, Stories, photos, and more (Jay Peters/The Verge)
